title: Zagames pays $55m for Melbourne suburban office building
text:
Melbourne's Zagame family has struck one of the biggest suburban office deals of the year, after agreeing to pay $55 million for a Hawthorn building leased to Swinburne University.

The deal for 2 Luton Lane, struck on a fully leased yield of 5.3 per cent, delivered a 46 per cent capital gain to Sydney-based investment firms Trumen Corp and Bricktop Group, which paid $37 million for the four-level building in 2015.

2 Luton Lane sold at a massive mark up to its previous selling price.

The buyer, Zagame Luton Lane is jointly owned and directed by Victor and Robert Zagame, the sons of the late Victor Zagame who established the family's family's hospitality business in 1971,

The 2 Luton Lane building comprises 5660 sq m of office space and occupies a strategic site near the corner of Burwood and Glenferrie Roads.

The sale follows soon after a high-net-worth Hong Kong investor paid about $30 million to buy the Clayton headquarters of paint giant Dulux on a yield of about 6 per cent and provides further evidence of the wave of money pouring into suburban office assets as investors chase yields amid record low interest rates.
description: Selling agents said the building rate of almost $10,000 per sqm paid for 2 Luton Lane was the highest for a metropolitan Melbourne office in 2019.
